body.name: A Most Unlikely Hero, Vol. 2: A Sci-Fi Harem Light Novel
body.description: Sometimes life gives you lemons. Other times it gives you bodacious alien babes.Alexander S. Ryker has decided to let Gabrielle continue living with him, despite now knowing that she is the daughter to the Emperor of the Galaxy. Whether this was a sound decision remains to be seen. Between the two of them constantly making inventions that explode, the sexy situations that he invariably winds up, and a host of alien suitors who wish for Gabrielle’s hand in marriage—and who are willing to do anything to get it—Alex is about to find himself beset by dangerous and erotic scenarios.The life of a wannabe hero is never easy.Scroll up and click to READ this hot harem sci-fi light novel now! Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A complete surprise
reviews.reviewText: First off we find out that alex might be either half angelisian or whole angelisian, and from the ending that is provided , we might guess that alex could possibly be grand nephew of king of the galaxy. Want to find out if alex is related to gabrielle or to her father or even a cousin? Read the next volume, i know i intend to.Reccomended for all sci fi and harem or manga and anime fans.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2017
reviews.reviewText: A good story, worthy successor to the first installation.I'm not too fond of the manner in which Mr. Varnell includes characters with no sense of boundaries, but the involvement in this story is much more believable (not to mention less in depth) than his American Kitsune series. I hope he continues this trend.The growth of the characters are frankly quite excellent. It's not Tolkein by any means, but there are certain points of genius here. I like how the 'curse' (my word not his) that has plagued the protagonist's inventions seems to be wearing off, which I take to mean that having a partner is bringing back the inspiration/mojo/magic. Or maybe it's even more subtle, which is the point I really like; the answer isn't always obvious.The science angle is good too. Having a superheated sand gun is frankly a new one on me.Pacing overall is better in this second installment. There's much less Fourth Wall breakage (which is REALLY appreciated, if you read this Mr. Varnell), and the relationship is smoothly handled. Expanding the potential 'harem' looks to be improved in this tale; still a bit iffy on the step sister (despite the lack of blood ties), but the other characters appear to be working just fine.Worth a buy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A welcome twist on the genre
reviews.reviewText: Similar to the first book, this feels like a sideways clone of the To Love Ru franchise. And yet again, Brandon Varnell proves he can make it work.This book doesn't really introduce any new characters, and instead focuses on expanding the backstories and personalities of the characters already in the series, a welcome change in this genre.I know this is a short review, but there's very little I can say without spoiling the story or giving away certain elements.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2021
reviews.reviewText: It really is like reading an anime... Currently it's more ecchi than not with plenty of fan service, but features many of the best troupes anime has to offer... I will definitely continue reading.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Dialogue still cringey
reviews.reviewText: MC's dialogue is still cringey at times but it has improved somewhat from 1 to 2. I am a fan of To Love-Ru so I like the similarities just wish there was a more glaring difference other than the MCs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Read! Would Read Again!
reviews.reviewText: I have been following Brandon for years now starting from back when he was writing Naruto Fanfiction. When he started writing his own books I was stoked and could not wait to read them since I loved the way he wrote his Fanfictions. I immensely enjoyed reading A Most Unlikely Hero Book One and Book Two and would highly recommend those who enjoy an anime style of fiction. Cheers!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars The Humor, Girls, and Trouble Add Up
reviews.reviewText: Well, it looks like I was correct in assuming that "A Most Unlikely Hero" was based off the anime, "To-Love-Ru."The story of Alex S. Ryker continues as things get more exciting and crazy for him. He and the lovely alien Princess Gabrielle continue to dabble in inventing, fun, and highly embarrassing, sexy moments.There's plenty of action, humor, science-fiction lingo, malfunctioning gadgets, sexiness, and destruction of public property to go around. In Vol. 2, we're introduced to a number of lovely girls with plenty of personality and potential, but Alex hasn't yet expressed much romance to any of them yet, not even Gabrielle. However, he IS starting to realize it. It's only a matter of time before his feelings become too much for him to hide.It would also seem that Alex has a hidden secret that not even he himself is aware of. Something about his past and/or family.Though short, this volume was another good read in the series, and the illustrations by XuaHanNin are VERY lovely.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2020
reviews.reviewText: This a fun light novel and I am enjoying this series immensely ! Looking forward to seeing Alexander come into the center of the harem . I guess I have to keep reading to see....;)
Aliens. Cool frigging deadly frigging aliens with wings. Female Shikamaru clone. Lots of troublesome fun! Read to see what I mean

reviews.reviewTitle: A great volume to follow up volume 2.
reviews.reviewText: A great follow up to the first volume.We get fed some more details on all the characters as well as some more foreshadowing of things to come.The action scenes are pretty good with Alex being competent and smart but hardly overpowering.The ecchi is definitely ramping up nicely. The beautiful beautiful ecchi.Keep up the good work.
